Allu Arjun Granted Regular Bail in Theatre Stampede Case

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Actor Allu Arjun was granted regular bail by a local court in connection with a tragic stampede incident during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2'.

  • Allu Arjun was arrested following the December 4 stampede at the Sandhya 70MM theatre in Hyderabad.
  • The incident resulted in the death of a 35-year-old woman and the hospitalization of her 9-year-old son due to asphyxiation.
  • The stampede occurred as fans rushed to see Allu Arjun and music director Devi Sri Prasad.
  • Hyderabad Police filed charges against Allu Arjun and his security team under various sections of the law.
A 35-year-old woman died and her nine-year-old son was hospitalized due to asphyxiation after a huge crowd jostled.

This incident has raised discussions on crowd management and safety protocols during high-profile events.

summary:
Netflix Accidentally Reveals Squid Game Season 3 Release Date, Deletes Post Later

Squid Game fans are buzzing after Netflix Korea accidentally revealed the release date for Season 3 of the hit series, which is scheduled for June 27, 2025. The post was quickly deleted after going viral.

  • Season 3 is confirmed to release sooner than anticipated, just six months away.
  • The reveal came through a now-deleted video shared on Netflix Korea's social media.
  • Creator Hwang Dong-hyuk discussed initially envisioning Seasons 2 and 3 as one, before realizing it would be too much content for a single season.
  • The series continues to feature returning cast members including Lee Jung-jae and Lee Byung-hun.
  • New cast members have joined the series in its second season.

This kind of behavior needs to be taken seriously. She needs to be called out and made to realize that what she has done is absolutely unacceptable. They should own up to it.   • Farmers expressed disappointment, saying he should have joined their protests instead of meeting with the Prime Minister.
  • The meeting raised doubts about his intentions towards the farmers' issues.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a farmer leader, continues a hunger strike demanding legal guarantees for minimum support prices (MSP).
  • The farmers' struggle persists until their demands are met.
“If Diljit truly cared about farmers, he would have come and joined us in solidarity...”

Diljit's past support for farmers contrasts sharply with his recent actions, prompting a strong backlash from the community he previously championed.
